tool.name: Calculate Priors Probability Estimates

param.name: design
param.label: Priors Design File
param.help: Select the Priors Design file [created by the Reformat Sample Design File Tool]

param.name: collection
param.label: Select dataset collection for Prior Calculations
param.help: Datasets in this collection can be generated from simulated or DNA reads using the Align and Count' and 'Summarize counts' Workflows.

tool.help:
**Tool Description**
The Calculate Priors tool calculates prior probability estimates for each of the comparates. Prior Probability is a part of Bayesian statistical inference, and is useful for ruling out whether alleles aligning better to one parent is due to allelic imbalance, or if it is really due to mapping biases or technical errors in the data. This important for future analysis with the Bayesian module, which determines the extent of the difference in allelic expression amongst the parental genomes for the features of interest, and must be yielded without influence from possible points of bias.
The output file contains computations for three variables, prior_[comparate name]_g1 and prior_[comparate name]_g2, which represent the probability that the feature will align to either parental genome, and prior_[comparate name]_both, which are the chances the feature will align to equally well to both genomes.
Calculation::
prior_{comparate)_both= [# reads aligning equally to both genomes] prior_{comparate)_{G1/G2}= 1-(prior_both) ----------------------------------------- -------------- [total uniquely mapped reads] 2
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Inputs**
**Prior Design File [REQUIRED]**
(1) This tool requires the Priors Design file, which can be created using the *Reformat Sample Design File* tool.
The design file must be in the following format and contain the correct header order:
1. G1- This is the name of the paternal genome 2. G2- The name of the maternal genome 3. comparate - contains comparate conditions. Excludes replicate number.
Example of input design file::
+-------+------+-----------+ | G1 | G2 | comparate | +-------+------+-----------+ | W1118 | W55 | W55_M | +-------+------+-----------+ | W1118 | W55 | W55_M | +-------+------+-----------+
**Input for Priors Calculations - Summed ASE Counts Tables [Required]**
The collection of datasets in Summarized and Filtered Format. These datasets can be generated by running simulated or DNA reads through the 'Align and Count' and 'Summarize Counts' Workflows.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Tool Outputs**
-One TSV file containing the calculated prior probabilities for reads that align preferentially to G1, G2, and those that align equally to both.
